meanings.sent1: The flukey discovery of a four-leaf clover brought her good luck.
meanings.sent2: It was flukey that he found a parking spot right in front of the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The flukey bounce of the ball made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her flukey guess turned out to be the winning answer.
meanings.sent5: The flukey rainbow after the storm was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or involving luck or chance.
meanings.sent1: The flukey coin toss determined who would go first.
meanings.sent2: She relied on her flukey intuition to make decisions.
meanings.sent3: His flukey habit of finding money in his pockets made him smile.
meanings.sent4: The flukey nature of the situation left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent5: The flukey alignment of events led to a successful outcome.

meanings.sent1: The flukey weather made planning a picnic difficult.
meanings.sent2: His flukey behavior confused his friends.
meanings.sent3: The flukey pattern of the lights flickering amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The flukey market fluctuations kept investors on edge.
meanings.sent5: The flukey flight path of the butterfly captivated onlookers.
